p: DDRP requires the R statistical software platform and can be run from the command line or within RStudio [ 47]. It takes advantage of functions from several R packages for data manipulation, analysis, and post-model processing. The raster package [ 48] is used to crop daily temperature rasters to the focal area, store and manipulate daily loop raster results, and process and further analyze results for each cohort. Many non-spatial data manipulations are conducted with functions in the dplyr, tidyr, and stringr packages [ 49â€“ 51]. The ggplot2 package [ 52] is used to generate and save summary maps of raster outputs, and options from the command line argument are parsed using the optparse package [ 53].
